meanings.definition: To extend over a larger area
meanings.sent1: The vines were spreading across the garden, reaching towards the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She was spreading butter on her toast for breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the surprise party was spreading faster than wildfire.
meanings.sent4: His influence was spreading like ripples in a pond, touching everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The news of the new store opening was spreading excitement throughout the town.

meanings.definition: The act of distributing or dispersing something widely
meanings.sent1: The spreading of flyers helped promote the charity event.
meanings.sent2: The spreading of seeds by the wind ensured new plants would grow.
meanings.sent3: The spreading of laughter in the room made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The spreading of kindness is like planting seeds of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The spreading of news through social media can happen in an instant.

meanings.sent1: The spreading river flooded the fields, creating a wider landscape.
meanings.sent2: The spreading branches of the tree provided ample shade on hot days.
meanings.sent3: Her smile grew even wider, spreading joy to those around her.
meanings.sent4: The spreading influence of technology is evident in every aspect of our lives.
meanings.sent5: The spreading colors of the sunset painted the sky in a beautiful display.
